stadium.name: The Cliffside Pitch
stadium.description: A perilous, windswept field built next to the town's lighthouse. There is no ocean-side barrier, and the wind is notoriously unpredictable. The tusk-like lighthouse is the only landmark.

stats.pregame_ritual: Telling each other exaggerated lies about their own strength.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

preGame: Step right up, ladies, gentlemen, and fellow denizens of the deep! It is a glorious Tuesday for a do-or-die showdown at The Cliffside Pitch! We are at the climax of this Best of Three playoff series, and the tension is higher than the lighthouse looming over this windswept death-trap! The Southport Narwhals and the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures are tied at one win apiece, and today, one of these squads is going to be tossed into the loser's bracket like yesterday's chum! I haven't been this excited since Morgwae and Artorias busted me out of the Demon Prison! The atmosphere is electric, even if the popularity polls suggest the realm is sleeping on these two gritty powerhouses. Those Haven Lights fans wouldn't know real action if it bit them in the britches! Over on the Narwhals' side, Malcolm Goer is getting his 'grip' ready by rubbing the ball on his armpits‚Äîa scent that'll knock a man over faster than a Gale-Force Wind! Meanwhile, Fogel Raynold for the Chaos Creatures is slapping his own helmet until his ears ring. Now that is the kind of brain-rattling dedication I love to see! We've got sea spray in the eyes and rocky outcroppings underfoot‚Äîperfect conditions for some playoff mayhem! ü¶àüèíüí•
postGame: Holy mackerel, what a display of sheer Monteforte dominance! The Chaos Creatures have completed the comeback, taking Game Three with a 4-0 shutout and sending the Narwhals packing to the loser's bracket! It was a symphony of violence that would make Lord Orzalon weep with pride. üèüÔ∏èüî• From the first whistle, it was clear that the ruffians from the city were ready to brawl. Blood Eppes thought he could stretch his hamstrings for seven minutes and be ready, but Mouldon Earl had other plans, leveling him with a tackle that surely rattled every bone in his body! ü¶¥üí• The Narwhals tried to answer back when Blood Eppes managed to take out Gabriele Klehm, but the momentum stayed firmly with the visitors. It reminds me of why I love this game‚Äîthe 'heroes' like Sir Artorias would probably call for a timeout, but here, we just call for the healer! üöëüó°Ô∏è Crescint Sonia did his best to keep Southport in it by injuring Wolbrom Ariella, but you just can't keep a good Chaos Creature down! The first real blow to the scoreboard came from Placido Kora. She didn't even wait to get close, launching a spectacular shot from Center Field that sailed through the basket for two big points! üéØ2Ô∏è‚É£ The crowd at the Cliffside Pitch went silent, save for the sound of the wind and the groans of the injured. We went into Halftime with the Narwhals trailing and smelling like armpits and defeat. üåäü•™ When the second half started, the violence only intensified! Tucker Hett became a one-woman wrecking crew, absolutely demolishing both Crescint Sonia and Malcolm Goer in back-to-back plays. It‚Äôs a wonder Sand Denys had any bandages left in the medical kit! ü©πü©∏ Then, the nail in the coffin arrived! Mouldon Earl, not content with just injuring people, found himself in Home Field and launched another two-point beauty! 4-0, and the Narwhals were looking like they'd been fished out of a dry bucket. üé£üìâ The Southport squad tried to rally, with Raouf Dragone advancing the ball, but Torey Dannye's tackle on Raouf just added to the casualty list. Even the 'Hero' Geth the Gravelord would have to tip his dusty hat to the carnage we witnessed today. üíÄüé© Cilurzo Sochor managed to injure Placido Kora late in the game, but by then, the Chaos Creatures were just playing with their food. Torey Dannye's day ended painfully as Placido returned the favor with a bone-crunching tackle of her own. ü•äüå™Ô∏è It was a masterpiece of playoff intensity! The Chaos Creatures move forward, while the Narwhals have to figure out how to win in the loser's bracket. This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from a very bloody, very salt-crusted Southport! Stay violent, Osterra! üéôÔ∏èüòà
